result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Rene Navarro was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court
Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil judgment entered against defendant for unpaid court ordered financial obligations.

supervisions.notes: **AMENDED 7-16-2016:  The first 2 years of sentence is to include credit for time served.** Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 6 years bifurcated sentence.   Eligible for CIP and SAP after serving 2 years confinement.

superMiscConds.notes: No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.

Provide DNA sample as required by law and pay assessed surcharge.  Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Obey all rules and regulations of supervising agent.  Cooperate with counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate.  Follow through with recommendations.  No contact with Samantha Weiss.  No contact with victims.  If undergoing any type of medical procedure, defendant is to inform physicians that he has had an opiage issue.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.  Firearm prohibition warning given.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

Defendant Michael Rene Navarro in court with attorney Kathleen Renee Lang.  Defendant Michael Rene Navarro in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The State is in compliance w/Ch. 950. Parties have reviewed PSI as well as the letter provided today by Ms. Lang Muffitt. Deft is stipulating to restitution. No additions or corrections noted by parties. 15cf578-6 yrs bifurated as 3/3, 15CF1624-4 yrs WPS bifurcated as 2/2, consec and in 15CF11-consec probation.

BTC: 15CF578-Total sentence is 6 yrs WPS bifurcated as 3 yrs IC, 3 yrs ES/CFTS
         15CF11-On both counts, total sentence is 4 yrs WPS bifurcated as 2 yrs IC, 2 yrs ES - STAYED. 3 yrs probation, consec to time being served. If probation is revoked, the time will be consec.
         15CF1624-Total sentence is 4 yrs WPS bifurcated as 2 yrs IC, 2 yrs ES, consec to 15CF578

Conditions
obey all rules and regs
restitution $1529.02 to ECU in 15CF578
costs
DNA sample if not already provided & costs
no alc/cs except by Rx-UA's
any counseling deemed approp by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care
FT emp
no contact with Samantha Weiss
no contact with victims
if deft undergoes any type of medical procedures, deft is to inform physicians that he has had an opiate issue

FAW/vote

IS eligible for CIP and SAP AFTER 2 YEARS OF CONFINEMENT

Attorney Kathleen Renee Lang in court.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for Sharon Riek for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Marilyn Leedle.
The Court has received a ZCI report regarding defendant's current status. Defendant was given furlough to attend to some medical issues but deft has cut off his GPS bracelet and has left the residence. Ms. Lang Muffitt spoke to the deft's mother who indicated that the information is correct.  The State asks for BW/BF

from Zimmerman Consulting Inc. - defendant is in violation of agency requirements.

Ct 1: 961.41(1)(d)1-Manuf/Del Heroin. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

AMENDED 07-02-2015; DEFENDANT IS ALLOWED FURLOUGH FOR MEDICAL TESTING/APPOINTMENTS. DEFENSE WILL PROVIDE THE STATE PROOF OF EACH APPOINTMENT

AMENDED 08/19/2015 - DEFENDANT MAY BE RELEASED TO ATTEND PRE-OP APPOINTMENT ON AUGUST 20, 2015 AT 2:00 PM AND HE SHALL BE RETURNED TO RACINE COUNTY JAIL AFTER SURGERY AND RECOVERY ON OCTOBER 26, 2015 NO LATER THAN 5:00 PM. WHILE RELEASED, DEFENDANT SHALL BE ON GPS/HOUSE ARREST WITH EXCEPTIONS ONLY FOR DOCTOR APPOINTMENTS, SURGERY, THERAPY APPOINTMENTS, ATTORNEY APPOINTMENTS, AND COURT.
for furlough

for furlough. Defendant may be released to attend his pre-op appt at Wheaton Franciscan on 8/20/15 at 3:20 pm. He shall be released from RCJ no later than 2:30 pm on August 20, 2015 and will return no later than 6:00 pm on August 20, 2015.

Defendant Michael Rene Navarro in court with attorney Kathleen Renee Lang.  Defendant Michael Rene Navarro in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Deft has given Ms. Lang some information that she needs to investigate. Deft is scheduled to have surgery at the end of August so defense asks for STC mid to end of Sept. Regarding the furlough request, the State is concerned about how deft's pain will be managed after surgery and leaves decision to the discretion of the Court.

BTC: 15CF11 is to be set for JT.  Bonds may be modified to allow deft to have his pre-op appt on 8/20 and surgery on 8/31. Deft must be on house arrest exceptions only for doctor appts, therapy appts, court or atty appts. GPS to monitor.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 15, 2016 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for March 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
